subject: Re: another lengthy post about ebay in answer to margaret
author: psfponies
full_text:
Bruce

I hate to admit this but when I first heard about the Franks box on 
paranormal state I went to ebay to see if there were any on there. I 
also did a search for Ghost box but lucky for me there wasnt any on 
ebay at the time, cause I would of foolishly paid the $49.95 plus 
shipping to get the RS hack that is on ebay now. (dont think I would 
of gone as high as some of the bidder have gone)

Kay


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday 
<paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
>
> 
> Margaret,
>  
> In my initial reply I voiced my disdain for low lives that take 
advantage of unwary people
> but did not advocate any action by any researchers on this board.
>  
> My goal is not just pacifism for it's own sake, believe me any of 
the old timers here can attest to my temper.
> My concern is for the negative disruption in the energy flow of 
the communication.
> I think that following the example of "turn the other cheek" will 
be very well received on the other side and therefore 
> contribute to strengthening the bridge.
>  
> In the past couple of days I know Kristin has received messages 
about the seven and the circle, 
> these are metaphors for peace, harmony and cooperation of energies 
within the communication.
>  
> It is not the first time we have received messages with these 
examples, I personally have received numerous 
> messages pertaining to circle, circles and the power of seven. It 
has been contemplated in length here more than once.
>  
> I have, through interpretation of communication over a long period 
of time, come to PERSONALLY believe that the urgence of 
> harmony and positive energy is the fertilizer of the growth of our 
communication with the spirit world.
>  
> I'm sorry, I drifted off the subject at hand, but my reason is 
relevant to this commentary. 
> Taking any action against this ebay fool will first and foremost 
serve our ego's and secondly
> may help to provide information to unwary buyers that is contrary 
to what this thief is putting out.
>  
> But could that not be accomplished through other venues that would 
help to educate many more people that
> are would be box researchers and do not look to ebay as a source 
for an RS hack. But are seeking general knowledge.
>  
> And Margaret to thine own self be true, when this was brought up 
my first reaction was to figure out a way to sabotage
> this guy's business venture. After thinking it over and asking 
myself what the first reason for doing that would be. My answer
> Was, to get this asshole that is exploiting something that I hold 
very dear, and in turn help to steer unaware buyers away from 
getting screwed.
>  
> But still my initial and primal reason was to inflict some sort of 
punishment on a person that I felt was unscrupulous. And I decided 
that this was
> a negative emotion and would generate negative energy, no matter 
how I tried to convince myself it was in the name of justice.
>  
> That goes without even mentioning the fact that we are not the say 
all and do all of this research. There are other entities involved 
that I would think 
> have better influential power than we do. If they want it stopped 
they will find a way to stop it. I know what your going to say, 
maybe we are the 
> tools they are using to stop this injustice. That may very well 
be, and if so then that is the way it will play out.
>  
> I think you mistake what I am implying. I am not saying do 
nothing, quite the opposite. It is actually our duty to do 
something. All I'm saying is there 
> are alternative ways to educate unwary possible researchers that 
would be 100% positive and not entail any type of stone throwing 
tactics.
>  
> I have said my piece now at the expense of boring everyone to 
death. So I will see how this unfolds, and during my daily session 
will inquire about how our friends feel about it.
>  
> Bruce
> Bruce Halliday

> Hi Bruce. I don't see this so much as an assault on anyone, as it 
is simply bringing awareness into a forum (ebay) where it is 
desperately needed. Was it not you who recently stated sellers who 
take advantage of others in this way are "no more than thieves 
without guns" and "should not be patronized no matter the 
circumstances." You have characterized them as "wolves" and "demons" 
but now are saying "do nothing." Which, honestly, I could understand 
if my suggestion was coming from a place of vengeance. It is 
not.THIS IS ABOUT EDUCATION FIRST AND FOREMOST, and standing up for 
those who are, unknowingly, being taken advantage of. The byproduct 
of providing this education will be allowing consumers to make an 
informed decision and if that hurts the sales of unscrupulous 
sellers, then so be it. Ann has just echoed some of my remarks in 
earlier posts in support of sellers rights to take advantage of the 
market ... that some people may find it's worth it to pay more to 
someone to receive a previously hacked unit. I would venture to 
guess, this educational information will A) help prevent those who 
are capable of doing the hack themselves from being duped, and B) 
force sellers who do offer pre-hacked units to do so for a 
more 'reasonable' fee. This is neither spiteful nor aggressive, and 
it's certainly not any kind of vengeance driven on my part. It's 
standing up for the uninformed, leveling the playing field for 
sellers, and it's bringing more people the knowledge that 
doing 'box' research is not an exclusive club that only the rich can 
take part in (and given the pricing on the bids for these units, 
people are under the false assumption that you have a pay a high 
price to get your hands on a limited resource, when that simply is 
not the case.)I can see nothing but positive benefits coming from 
educating people about their options.Margaret--- In EVP-

out there for > them and we are here to help them and guy's like Mr. 
ebay will > disappear on their own.> > And we will not have expended 
an ounce of negative energy in the > process.> That's how I feel, 
but that's just me.> > Bruce>
